private_information: This peg initially holds disks from top to bottom: A, B, C, D, E, F, G.
Disks are ordered by size where A is the smallest and G is the largest.
left_peg.goal: Describe the current state of the left peg using atomic predicates and list the legal single-disk moves that originate from this peg under Hanoi rules.

middle_peg.goal: Describe the current state of the middle peg using atomic predicates and list the legal single-disk moves that originate from this peg under Hanoi rules.

right_peg.goal: Describe the current state of the right peg using atomic predicates and list the legal single-disk moves that originate from this peg under Hanoi rules.

orchestrator.goal: Integrate peg state descriptions and produce a complete PDDL domain and PDDL problem for the 7-disk Tower of Hanoi instance suitable to be solved by the FastDownward planner.

public_information: There are three pegs named left, middle, and right.
There are seven disks labeled A, B, C, D, E, F, G ordered from smallest A to largest G.
Only one disk may be moved at a time.
A larger disk may never be placed on top of a smaller disk.
Initial configuration: left peg from top to bottom holds A, B, C, D, E, F, G; middle and right pegs are empty.
Goal configuration: left peg empty, middle peg empty, right peg from top to bottom holds A, B, C, D, E, F, G.

describe.system_prompt: You are an expert describing local peg states for planning. Do not produce a full PDDL domain or problem. Instead produce a concise set of atomic facts that represent the contents of the left peg and enumerate legal single-disk move templates originating from the left peg.
describe.prompt: Your name is left_peg. You are given the public information about the Tower of Hanoi instance and your private information describing the left peg contents. Provide a list of atomic predicates that represent the left peg state suitable for inclusion in a PDDL initial state, for example using predicates like (on disk peg) and (ontop disk disk) and (clear peg_or_disk). Also list legal move templates that move the top disk from the left peg to another peg expressed informally so the orchestrator can translate them into PDDL actions. Do not assume any information beyond the provided public and private information.

describe.system_prompt: You are an expert describing local peg states for planning. Do not produce a full PDDL domain or problem. Instead produce a concise set of atomic facts that represent the contents of the middle peg and enumerate legal single-disk move templates originating from the middle peg.
describe.prompt: Your name is middle_peg. You are given the public information about the Tower of Hanoi instance and your private information describing the middle peg contents. Provide a list of atomic predicates that represent the middle peg state suitable for inclusion in a PDDL initial state, and list legal move templates that move the top disk from the middle peg to another peg expressed informally so the orchestrator can translate them into PDDL actions. Do not assume any information beyond the provided public and private information.

describe.system_prompt: You are an expert describing local peg states for planning. Do not produce a full PDDL domain or problem. Instead produce a concise set of atomic facts that represent the contents of the right peg and enumerate legal single-disk move templates originating from the right peg.
describe.prompt: Your name is right_peg. You are given the public information about the Tower of Hanoi instance and your private information describing the right peg contents. Provide a list of atomic predicates that represent the right peg state suitable for inclusion in a PDDL initial state, and list legal move templates that move the top disk from the right peg to another peg expressed informally so the orchestrator can translate them into PDDL actions. Do not assume any information beyond the provided public and private information.

pddl.system_prompt: You are an expert in multi-agent planning and PDDL targeting the FastDownward planner. Your job is to integrate peg state descriptions from the other agents into a single coherent PDDL domain and PDDL problem that models the 7-disk Tower of Hanoi instance. You must produce a complete STRIPS-compatible domain and a problem file suitable for FastDownward. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags. Ensure action names are clear and that the disk ordering and peg objects match the provided information.
pddl.prompt: You are the orchestrator. You have received the peg state descriptions from the three peg agents. Integrate the provided atomic facts and move templates to construct a PDDL domain and a PDDL problem for the global goal where all seven disks move from left to right without ever placing a larger disk on a smaller one. Use objects for disks A B C D E F G and pegs left middle right. Define predicates and actions required to model Hanoi rules, and include an initial state that matches the provided peg facts and a goal state where right peg contains A through G in correct order. Target FastDownward compatibility when choosing features and constructs. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags.
